column3: OK, so you want removal of stuff from doc/README.md, will do.\n
Yes, either you should remove it or leave it alone (to be cleaned up by someone else). Extending it at least makes no sense.\n
Force pushed to update only the build requirements.  doc/README.md should be cleaned up separately.\n

Interesting. Good catch - this hasn't been true for a while. We now link qt statically on Linux, so there is no actual need to install any run-time library. \nBuilding is explained in `build-unix.md` so this part can go entirely (as this is targeted at people installing the binaries).\n
You're technically correct, just it's never listed in any build requirements because it's assumed to be in the minimum build requirements of anything in Fedora.\n
